pr_title: SAMZA-2581: Fix Samza Histogram update to update percentile Gauge values

timeline.bodyText: Looks like this line is unnecessary? The "values" variable is never being used.
timeline.author: xiefan46

timeline.message:
SAMZA-2581: Fix Samza Histogram update to update percentile Gauge values

Symptom: Missing metrics. EventSystemConsumer consumer lag latency
metrics are missing.

Cause: Histogram update and percentile gauges are updated in two
different functions. Percentiles are internal to Samza histogram and
hence should be updated internally as part of update.

Changes: Histogram update also updates internal gauges.

timeline.bodyText: Looks like the gauge value is already updated when it is reported (line 76 Gauge#visit). Why do we need to update them on every new datapoint?
timeline.author: prateekm

replies.bodyText: good point. @prateekm is it possible that this is never called? We are seeing the values a 0, so I assumed this could be the issue.
replies.author: vishwajith-s

replies.bodyText: Also by the way this code is being called from Brooklin code in Brooklin cluster. Not sure if the visit is called
replies.author: vishwajith-s

replies.bodyText: @prateekm as discussed doing it in the getValue of the Histogram.
replies.author: vishwajith-s
